title: Karen Aardal
summary: Karen I. Aardal (born 1961)[1] is a Norwegian and Dutch applied mathematician, theoretical computer scientist, and operations researcher. Her research involves combinatorial optimization, integer programming, approximation algorithms, and facility location, with applications such as positioning emergency vehicles to optimize their response time.[2] She is a professor in the Delft Institute of Applied Mathematics at the Delft University of Technology,[3] and the chair of the Mathematical Optimization Society for the 2016â€“2019 term.[4][5]
